page.title: 11THE ALLOTMENTS
page.content: On the Western side of our school field is land used for allottments which was also what the land was used for before the school was built in 1972. There are about 20 allottments left on the plot now. The crops that were growing were peas, potatoes, beetroot, rapberiies, gooseberries, onions, lettuces, cabbages, beans, currants, rhubarb and mint. The tools being used were forks, hoes, shovels and spades. We saw a dogrose, some sweetwilliams,honeysuckle, irises, roses, carnations and pansies being grown. We met a man who was going to plant some cabbages. Our teacher asked the man how long he had had his plot and he said 7 years. He said he had no flowers growing, only vegetables, and he spent a lot of time digging, planting and weeding.
